```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
# Generate random question parameters
sf <- 3 # Number of significant figures to use
t <- signif(runif(1, 2, 3), sf) # 0 to 60 mph time in seconds

vf <- 60 * 1609.34 / 3600 # 60 mph in m/s

# Calculate the correct answer and distractors
a <- signif(vf / t, sf)
distractors <- c(signif(60 / t, 3))
sc <- num_to_schoice(a, wrong = distractors, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sapply(sc$questions, signif, sf)

# Format numbers
sc$questions <- sprintf("\\SI{%g}{m/s^2}", sc$questions)
```

Question
========
An F1 car accelerates from $0$ to $60$ miles per hour in $\SI{`r t`}{s}$. What is the acceleration of the car in SI units? ($\SI{1}{mile} = \SI{1609.34}{m}$)

```{r questionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
First, convert \SI{60}{mph} to \si{m/s}.

$$\SI{60}{mph} \times \frac{\SI{1609.34}{m}}{\SI{1}{mi}} \times \frac{\SI{1}{h}}{\SI{3600}{s}} = \SI{26.8223}{m/s}$$
Then, divide by the time.

$$a = \frac{v_f - v_i}{t} = \frac{\SI{26.8223}{m/s} - 0}{\SI{`r t`}{s}} = \SI{`r a`}{m/s^2}$$
